July 2023#

1 Sat#

HPol Loop#

  1. Started working on HPol Loop locally, will push regularly to Github

2 Sun#

HPol Loop#

  1. Working on HPol Loop Part A.

  2. TODO: learn about git submodule (for Shared-Code/GA)

  3. Github file name change [1] :

    git mv -f yOuRfIlEnAmE yourfilename

4 Tue#

HPol Work#

GA

  1. Back to going through the GA C++ files.

  2. There has to be a way to improve DataRead(). The file currently has an if check inside a for loop; probably not the msot efficient way to do this.

6 Thu#

HPol Work#

GA: DataRead.h

  1. Finished modifying DataRad.cpp and pushed to Github shared-code (HPol branch)

  2. The part that reads fitnessScores.csv inside DataRead.cpp only reads the first column.

    TODO: figure out what the second column of fitnessScores.csv is (in PAEA there are three columns actually)

8 Sat#

HPol Work#

GA: Sort.h

  1. Started modifying Sort.h.

9 Sun#

HPol Work#

GA: Sort.h

  1. original_location and t are probably not needed at all?

    TODO: Check again and get rid to these.

  1. Actually I’m not sure where we obtain parent_location. It doesn’t seem like DataRead.h provides this vector, and the whole original_location-stuff just seems weird. Is this part of the program incomplete?

10 Mon#

HPol Work#

GA: Sort.h

  1. Finished editing Sort.h and pushed to Github Shared-Code repo HPol branch.

  2. Will discuss the issue mentioned above during the meeting today.

Collaboration Meeting#

  1. From Ezio, regarding creating a remote hpol branch and allowing others to review the changes:

    you can push your local branch with git push origin <your-branch> and it will show you a link to create the PR on GitHub. Once you’ve created the PR you can keep adding commits to the branch and push them and it will update the PR.

11 Tue#

Git#

  1. A good video explaining how to squash git commits using git rebase -i <#>.

HPol Work#

GA: Sort.h

  1. Will test today if this still produces the desired result since I removed the vector original_location and int t yesterday.

    Edit: tested the above; script works just fine.

  2. Following Ezio’s advice, stopped making extraneous changes on HPol branch. Will make a patch branch to pake at and destroy and leave HPol alone until XF work is more or less done.

Cleanup Work#

  1. Started a new branch clean (local) based on hpol (base commit is HPol Pause (5fd61c6)). I will use this branch for my own understanding, possibly cleaning up the scripts as I go over them.

  2. From Ezio, regarding the workflow of GENETIS (in a close pull-request).

    1. create a local branch with some commits.

    2. push the branch onto Github (git push origin you-branch) and created a PR (it gives you a link to create it after the push)

    3. wait for reviews and comments.

    4. add more commits to he local branch to address the reviews/comments.

    5. push them to Github (git push origin your-branch, without forcing/squashing/rebasing) – the PR will update automatically to include the new commit

    6. repeat step 3-5 until the PR is approved

    7. click on the squash merge button on Github to merge the PR on main.

HPol Work#

Loop:

  1. Looking into the various Part_B1 scripts and the corresponding batch job.

HPol Work#

Loop:

Loop:

  1. Need to determine if we want to keep Part_B_GPU_job2_asym.sh. To do this I have to figure out the part where it differs from Part_B_GPU_job2 _asym_array.sh.

15 Sat#

HPol Work#

Loop: a. Finished most of Part_B2 third pass yesterday. b. Will start looking into Part C today. c. Will also checkout ssPermissionCheck.sh to see if I can get rid of it.

Bash#

  1. read option -r allows for ignoring backslash. For example:

    ~$ read
> Hello \
> World\
> !
~$ echo $REPLY

    returns Hello World! but read -r <<< "Hello\world!"; echo $REPLY returns Hello\world!
